title: VR-Based Ecological Dynamics Theory for Sports Language Communication and Strategic Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sports science knowledge, VR technology experience, and understanding of fundamental sports terminology and communication skills (grammar, vocabulary, expression)
context.additional_context: Building a Customized Sports Training Environment Using Digital Devices and Strengthening Real-World Decision-Making Abilities Through Ecological Dynamics Theory. Particularly focusing on verbal interactions (coaching instructions, team strategy discussions) and non-verbal communication (gestures, facial expressions) in sports contexts, with a program comprehensively enhancing learners' reading comprehension and expressive abilities

learning_goals: Design personalized training scenarios using VR systems, execute verbal/nonverbal communication strategies in sports contexts, and apply specialized vocabulary and expressions

Enhance real-time decision-making abilities in response to environmental changes based on ecological dynamics theory, acquiring effective feedback expression techniques (verbal/nonverbal) among team members
Develop creative problem-solving strategies while exploring diverse virtual environments, strengthening communication skills using specialized vocabulary and expressions tailored to sports contexts
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
